before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"15djg","text":"As we use commercial sperm straws to perform our extractions, we do not always know the composition of these straws, the quantity of material contained, the nature of the diluents and preservatives used. This is why it is sometimes necessary to use several straws to obtain enough material for sequencing. It is also sometimes wise to perform several washes (see step 3) to eliminate contaminants from diluents and preservatives.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ehjk","text":"Here we describe a method for isolate high molecular weight DNA from commercially available frozen bull semen straws.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37st0","text":"This protocol is based on a salting-out method and uses several commercially available solutions. It consists of several steps: washing of semen, lysis, removal of proteins and precipitation of genomic DNA.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14scp","text":"This protocol was used to isolate DNA from sixty semen straws, all of which were successfully sequenced using the CLR sequencing mode on the PacBio SequelII platform.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eiprt","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aasce","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.grant_id: Operational Program FEDER-FSE MIDI-PYRENEES ET GARONNE 2014-2020

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"69mfv","text":"Salting out is a good method to obtain high molecular weight (HMW) DNA, as it avoids damaging steps such as the use of purification columns or heavy mixing with phenol/chloroform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"735jn","text":"Note that all mixing steps should be gentle to obtain HMW DNA fragments (from lysis steps to DNA precipitation). We also recommend to use DNA low bind tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: extraction,high molecular weight,sperm,DNA,Long read sequencing,bovine,DNA isolation,PacBio

references.title: A Procedure for Quantitative Determination of Tris(2-Carboxyethyl)phosphine, an Odorless Reducing Agent More Stable and Effective Than Dithiothreitol
Rapid method for the isolation of mammalian sperm DNA.
references.authors: Wu H, de Gannes MK, Luchetti G, Pilsner JR

references.title: Large-scale detection and characterization of interchromosomal rearrangements in normozoospermic bulls using massive genotype and phenotype data sets.
references.authors: Jourdain J, Barasc H, Faraut T, Calgaro A, Bonnet N, Marcuzzo C, Suin A, Barbat A, Hozé C, Besnard F, Taussat S, Grohs C, Kuchly C, Iampietro C, Donnadieu C, Pinton A, Boichard D, Capitan A

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

buffer","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"19086","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"http://","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/","name":"Qiagen"}}},"7":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1mdcc","text":"DNA in EB buffer can be heated to 60°C for 1 hour to dissolve it. Do not vortex or pipet DNA.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3vvvp","text":"It is recommended not to freeze the DNA to preserve long fragments.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"8":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":432,"style":"italic"}],"key":"dgm4g","text":"Of the 60 extractions carried out using this protocol, the average size of the fragments generated is around 53 kb, ranging from 25 to 120 kb on average. We expect 30 ug of DNA from a commercial semen straw, but this figure can vary considerably from sample to sample. We obtained absorbance ratios of 260/280 for DNA of around 1.8 nm, and 260/230 ratios averaging 0.5 nm. Low ratios have already been observed using RLT buffer (Wu et al, 2018), but these did not affect PacBio sequencing significantly.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":65,"style":"italic"}],"key":"62p2b","text":"Some of these DNA  have been sequenced and published in Jourdain et al. 2023.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b0v9k","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"9":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","authors":"Jourdain J, Barasc H, Faraut T, Calgaro A, Bonnet N, Marcuzzo C, Suin A, Barbat A, Hozé C, Besnard F, Taussat S, Grohs C, Kuchly C, Iampietro C, Donnadieu C, Pinton A, Boichard D, Capitan A","can_edit":true,"date":1685577600,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1101/gr.277787.123","guid":"DC5A7958A3A64A009CBA2BFDF1D8C919","id":0,"journal":"","protocol_guid":"","protocol_id":0,"title":"Large-scale detection and characterization of interchromosomal rearrangements in normozoospermic bulls using massive genotype and phenotype data sets."}}}}
